intro: Carrierea vieillardii, commonly known as the mountain dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, and the plant is known for its resilience in harsh, alpine conditions. Carrierea vieillardii is often found in scrublands and open woodlands at elevations ranging from 500 to 2,000 meters.
